qas.question: A Macau citizen was arrested for posting a plea to disrupt the relay on what website?
In addition to cyberctm.com, what other website was shut down for two days?
Who was arrested on April 26 for posting an online message?
Who denied the shutdown was motivated by politics?

answers.text: The head of the Bureau of Telecommunications Regulation

context: <a2_0>A Macau resident<a2_0/> was arrested on April 26 for posting a message on <a0_0><a3_0>cyberctm.com<a3_0/><a0_0/> encouraging people to disrupt the relay. Both <a1_0>orchidbbs.com<a1_0/> and cyberctm.com Internet forums were shut down from May 2 to 4. This fueled speculation that the shutdowns were targeting speeches against the relay. <a4_0>The head of the Bureau of Telecommunications Regulation<a4_0/> has denied that the shutdowns of the websites were politically motivated. About 2,200 police were deployed on the streets, there were no interruptions.
